newsitem.title: JAPAN: Two Japanese commodity exchanges merge.
newsitem.headline: Two Japanese commodity exchanges merge.

text.p: The Kansai Agricultural Commodities Exchange said on Tuesday it had merged with the Kobe Silk Exchange to form the Kansai Commodities Exchange (KCE).
The KCE is now the fourth largest commodities exchange in Japan. "As part of our future plans, we'd like to study listing new contracts including grain," KCE president Kazuo Shimazaki said.
Futures contracts traded on the KCE are imported soybeans, red beans, raw sugar, refined sugar and silk. A raw sugar options contract is also listed on the exchange.
